formalized_text: The system shall provide a core scientific calculator module capable of performing standard arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division), trigonometric (sin, cos, tan), inverse trigonometric (asin, acos, atan), logarithmic (log, ln), and other scientific operations (exponential, power, square root, factorial).
original_text: The system shall provide a fully functional scientific calculator with standard arithmetic, trigonometric, and scientific operations.
assumptions: ['Standard IEEE 754 floating-point arithmetic precision is acceptable.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify that addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations produce correct results for a set of test cases, including integers, decimals, and negative numbers.', 'Verify that sin, cos, and tan functions produce correct results for inputs in degrees, radians, and gradians.', 'Verify that asin, acos, and atan functions produce correct results, respecting the selected angle mode for output.', 'Verify that log, ln, exp, x^y, square root, and factorial functions produce correct results for valid inputs.']

formalized_text: The system shall implement four distinct, specialized electronics calculation modes: 1) Ohm's Law & Power, 2) Resistor Combinations (Series/Parallel), 3) Resistor Color Code Conversion, and 4) 555 Timer Design (Astable/Monostable).
original_text: The system shall provide specialized modes for Ohm's Law & Power, Resistor Combinations (Series/Parallel), Resistor Color Code Conversion, and 555 Timer design.
assumptions: ['Users will have the necessary domain knowledge to use the specialized electronics modes.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify that a UI mechanism exists to switch between the core scientific calculator and the four specialized electronics modes.', 'Verify that each of the four specialized modes can be accessed and presents its unique user interface.']

formalized_text: The system shall provide a complete framework for user-defined calculation modes, including a guided wizard for creation, a management interface for viewing, editing, and deleting modes, and functionality to use the created modes.
original_text: The system shall provide a user-extensible framework for users to create, save, manage, and share their own custom calculation modes using a guided interface.
assumptions: ['Users will be able to formulate their calculations using standard algebraic syntax.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify that a user can launch a guided wizard to create a new custom mode.', 'Verify that a user can save a created mode to their account.', 'Verify that a dedicated UI section lists all user-created modes.', 'Verify that a user can launch, edit, and delete their custom modes from a management screen.']

formalized_text: The system shall implement a user account system that enables registration, login, and secure data persistence for user-specific data, including calculation history, user-defined variables, and custom calculation modes.
original_text: The system shall provide a user account system for persisting variables, calculation history, and custom modes.
assumptions: ['Users will have a valid email address for registration.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify that a new user can register for an account.', 'Verify that a registered user can log in.', "Verify that upon login, the user's specific history, variables, and custom modes are loaded.", 'Verify that any changes to user data are persisted to the backend and are available in subsequent sessions.']

formalized_text: The application shall be a responsive Single Page Application (SPA) that provides an optimal and consistent user experience across modern desktop and mobile web browsers, adapting its layout to various screen sizes.
original_text: The system shall be implemented as a responsive web application, accessible on modern desktop and mobile browsers.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the application renders correctly and is fully usable on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge on desktop.', 'Verify the application layout adapts and remains fully usable on screen widths corresponding to common mobile phones (e.g., 375px), tablets (e.g., 768px), and desktops (e.g., 1280px+).']

formalized_text: The project scope explicitly excludes the development and delivery of native mobile applications for iOS or Android platforms.
original_text: The system shall not be a native mobile application (iOS/Android).
constraints: ["All development effort must be focused on the web application."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify that no native mobile application artifacts are produced or planned as part of the project deliverables.']

formalized_text: The system shall not implement any feature for a public, centralized repository or 'marketplace' where users can browse, search, or download custom modes created by other users.
original_text: The system shall not provide a centralized, public repository or "marketplace" for sharing custom modes.
constraints: ["Sharing functionality is strictly limited to file-based export and import."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the application UI contains no features for browsing or discovering custom modes from other users.']

formalized_text: The sharing of custom calculation modes between users shall be exclusively facilitated through a file-based export/import mechanism. Users can export a mode to a file and other users can import it from that file.
original_text: The system shall limit sharing to file-based export and import.
assumptions: ['Users will manage the distribution of exported files themselves.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify that a user can export a custom mode, which results in a file download.', 'Verify that a user can import a valid mode file, which adds the mode to their list.']

formalized_text: The system shall not implement any real-time collaboration features, such as shared sessions, collaborative editing of custom modes, or live calculation sharing.
original_text: The system shall not provide real-time collaboration features between users.
constraints: ["The application is designed as a single-user experience."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the application architecture and features do not include any real-time communication channels (e.g., WebSockets) for user-to-user collaboration.']

formalized_text: The project scope explicitly excludes the development of circuit simulation (e.g., SPICE) or schematic drawing/capture functionalities.
original_text: The system shall not provide circuit simulation or schematic drawing capabilities.
constraints: ["The application's purpose is calculation, not simulation or design visualization."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify that no features related to circuit simulation or schematic drawing are present in the application.']

formalized_text: The client-side application must be fully compatible and functional on the latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari, and Microsoft Edge.
original_text: The client application shall run on a modern, standards-compliant web browser, including the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
constraints: ["Support for older browser versions or non-specified browsers (e.g., Internet Explorer) is not required."]
validation_criteria: ['Execute a suite of functional and UI tests successfully on the latest version of Chrome.', 'Execute a suite of functional and UI tests successfully on the latest version of Firefox.', 'Execute a suite of functional and UI tests successfully on the latest version of Safari.', 'Execute a suite of functional and UI tests successfully on the latest version of Edge.']

formalized_text: All backend services, databases, and supporting infrastructure for the application shall be deployed and managed within the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform.
original_text: The entire backend infrastructure shall be hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS).
validation_criteria: ['Verify that all production infrastructure resources are provisioned within an AWS account.', 'Confirm that no backend components are hosted on other cloud providers or on-premise servers.']

formalized_text: After the initial loading of the web application, the core scientific calculator functionalities must remain fully operational even if the user's internet connection is lost.
original_text: Core calculator functions shall operate offline after the initial application load.
assumptions: ['The application assets (HTML, CSS, JS) are cached by the browser or a service worker.']
validation_criteria: ['Load the application with an active internet connection.', 'Disconnect the internet connection (e.g., using browser developer tools).', 'Verify that standard arithmetic, trigonometric, and scientific calculations can still be performed successfully.']

formalized_text: The system must support offline data modifications by queuing changes locally in the browser's IndexedDB. When network connectivity is restored, the application shall automatically synchronize the queued local changes with the backend server.
original_text: The system shall implement a non-destructive offline data synchronization strategy. Changes made to user data (e.g., variables, history) while offline shall be queued locally using IndexedDB. Upon reconnection to the backend, the application shall automatically attempt to sync the queued changes.
validation_criteria: ['While online, log in and perform an action (e.g., save a variable).', 'Go offline and perform another action (e.g., add a calculation to history).', 'Verify the offline change is stored in IndexedDB.', 'Go back online and verify the application automatically sends the queued change to the server.', 'Verify the data is correctly persisted by refreshing the application or logging in from another device.']

formalized_text: The offline synchronization logic shall use specific conflict resolution strategies: 1) For append-only data (calculation history), offline entries shall be added to the server's list. 2) For mutable data (user variables), a 'last-write-wins' strategy shall be employed, where the server's version takes precedence in case of a timestamp conflict.
original_text: For append-only data like calculation history, offline items shall be merged with the server's list. For mutable data like user variables, a last-write-wins strategy shall be used based on timestamps, with the server's timestamp being authoritative in any conflict resolution scenario.
assumptions: ['Client and server clocks are reasonably synchronized for timestamp comparison.']
validation_criteria: ['Test Case (History): Add item A online. Go offline, add item B. Go online. Verify history contains both A and B.', 'Test Case (Variables): Set variable X=1 online. Go offline, set X=2. In another session, set X=3 online. Go online with the first session. Verify the final value of X is 3 (server authoritative).']

formalized_text: The frontend of the web application shall be developed using the React library (version 18 or later) and the TypeScript language for static typing.
original_text: The application shall be built using a technology stack of React/TypeScript for the frontend.
validation_criteria: ["Inspect the frontend project's `package.json` to confirm the use of `react`, `react-dom`, and `typescript` dependencies.", 'Verify that source code files use `.tsx` and `.ts` extensions and conform to TypeScript syntax.']

formalized_text: The backend services shall be developed using the Node.js runtime (LTS version), the NestJS framework for application architecture, and PostgreSQL (version 15 or later) as the relational database.
original_text: The application shall be built using a technology stack of Node.js/NestJS/PostgreSQL for the backend.
validation_criteria: ["Inspect the backend project's `package.json` to confirm the use of NestJS framework dependencies (`@nestjs/core`, etc.).", 'Verify the production database is a PostgreSQL instance.', 'Verify the runtime environment for backend services is Node.js.']

formalized_text: The execution of all user-defined formulas from custom modes must occur within a secure, isolated sandbox environment. This environment shall be implemented on AWS Lambda using the `isolated-vm` library. The use of the `vm2` library is strictly prohibited.
original_text: All user-defined formulas shall be executed within a secure, isolated sandbox using the `isolated-vm` library on AWS Lambda. The `vm2` library is explicitly forbidden due to critical, unpatched security vulnerabilities.
assumptions: ['`isolated-vm` provides sufficient security isolation for this use case.']
constraints: ["The sandbox environment shall have no network access.","The sandbox environment shall have no filesystem access.","The sandbox environment shall have strict resource limits (timeout, memory)."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify through code review that the formula execution service is an AWS Lambda function.', 'Verify that the `isolated-vm` library is a dependency and is used to execute the formula code.', "Verify that the `vm2` library is not present in the project's dependencies."]

formalized_text: The formula execution sandbox must be configured with a strict allow-list of callable functions and accessible constants. Only the following shall be exposed: functions `sin`, `cos`, `tan`, `asin`, `acos`, `atan`, `log`, `ln`, `exp`, `sqrt`, and constants `pi`, `e`, `k`, `e_charge`.
original_text: The sandbox environment shall be configured with an explicit allow-list of mathematical functions and constants available for use in custom formulas, as defined in REQ-FRX-001.
validation_criteria: ['Create a custom formula that uses an allowed function (e.g., `sin(pi)`) and verify it executes correctly.', 'Create a custom formula that attempts to use a disallowed function or object (e.g., `Math.random()`, `process.exit()`) and verify that the execution fails with a security or reference error.']

formalized_text: The file format for both exporting and importing user-defined custom modes shall be a structured JSON document. The JSON schema shall include a version number to facilitate future upgrades.
original_text: The file format for exporting and importing custom modes shall be JSON.
validation_criteria: ['Export a custom mode and verify the downloaded file is a valid JSON file.', 'Verify the exported JSON file contains a `schemaVersion` key.', 'Manually create a valid JSON file based on the defined schema and verify it can be imported successfully.']

formalized_text: The core scientific calculator must support three angle modes: Degrees, Radians, and Gradians. The UI must provide a control (e.g., a toggle or dropdown) to switch between these modes, and the currently active mode must be clearly and persistently displayed to the user.
original_text: The calculator shall support calculations in Degrees, Radians, and Gradians, with a UI control to switch between modes and a clear display of the active mode.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the presence of a UI control for selecting the angle mode.', 'Verify the UI clearly indicates the active mode (DEG, RAD, GRAD).', 'Calculate sin(90) in Degrees mode and verify the result is 1.', 'Calculate sin(pi/2) in Radians mode and verify the result is 1.', 'Calculate sin(100) in Gradians mode and verify the result is 1.']

formalized_text: The main calculator interface shall feature a primary display for the current expression and its result. A separate, scrollable history panel must display a list of previous calculations. Clicking on an entry in the history panel shall populate the main input with that entry's expression for re-use or modification.
original_text: The primary display shall show the current input and result, with a scrollable history panel for previous calculations. Clicking a history item shall load it for re-use.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the UI has a distinct area for current input/result and a history panel.', 'Perform several calculations (e.g., 2+2=4, 5*5=25).', "Verify that '2+2=4' and '5*5=25' appear as entries in the history panel.", "Click on the '2+2' history entry and verify that '2+2' is loaded into the main input field."]

formalized_text: The calculator's input parser must correctly interpret standard SI unit prefixes appended to numbers. The supported prefixes are: p (pico, 10^-12), n (nano, 10^-9), μ (micro, 10^-6), m (milli, 10^-3), k (kilo, 10^3), M (mega, 10^6), and G (giga, 10^9).
original_text: The system shall correctly parse inputs with SI prefixes (p, n, μ, m, k, M, G).
validation_criteria: ["Verify that input '1k' is evaluated as 1000.", "Verify that input '2.5M' is evaluated as 2,500,000.", "Verify that input '5m' is evaluated as 0.005.", "Verify that input '100n' is evaluated as 0.0000001.", "Verify that the parsing is case-sensitive as per REQ-BIZ-001 (e.g., 'm' is milli, 'M' is mega)."]

formalized_text: The system shall allow authenticated users to create, use, and manage named variables. Variable assignment shall use the syntax `variableName = expression`. All user-defined variables, along with standard memory register values (M+, M-, MR, MC), must be persisted to the user's account and be available across different sessions and devices.
original_text: Users shall be able to assign, use, view, and manage variables (`variableName = expression`). All memory values and user-defined variables shall be persisted across sessions.
validation_criteria: ['Enter `myVar = 5 * 10` and verify the variable `myVar` is created with the value 50.', 'Enter `myVar * 2` and verify the result is 100.', 'Verify there is a UI element to view all currently defined variables and their values.', 'Log out and log back in. Verify that the variable `myVar` and its value are still available.']

formalized_text: The application must include a comprehensive, searchable in-app help system. This system, accessible via a persistent global UI icon, will provide documentation for all features, including core functions, electronics modes, and custom mode creation. The help content will be authored and presented using the Docusaurus framework.
original_text: The system shall include a comprehensive, searchable in-app help system accessible from a global UI element as defined in REQ-UI-001. This system shall provide clear documentation on all application features... The implementation shall leverage Docusaurus for help content authoring and presentation...
constraints: ["A formal process for creating, reviewing, and maintaining help content shall be established."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify a help icon is always visible in the main application UI.', 'Clicking the icon opens the help system (e.g., in a modal or new tab).', 'Verify the help system contains sections for core calculator, electronics modes, and custom modes.', 'Verify the help system has a functional search bar.', 'Verify the help content is rendered from Docusaurus-generated artifacts.']

formalized_text: The creation of a custom mode shall be guided by a multi-step wizard interface. The wizard must allow the user to: 1) Provide a unique name and an optional description for the mode. 2) Define a set of named input variables. 3) Define a set of named output variables. 4) Write one or more formulas that calculate the output variables based on the input variables, using standard algebraic syntax.
original_text: The custom mode creation process shall be a multi-step wizard. The user shall provide a unique Name and an optional Description... define one or more Input Variables and one or more Output Variables... enter one or more formulas using standard algebraic syntax.
validation_criteria: ["Complete the wizard to create a simple mode (e.g., input 'radius', output 'area', formula 'area = pi * radius^2').", 'Verify the wizard enforces that a name is provided.', 'Verify the wizard requires at least one input and one output variable.', 'Verify the wizard requires at least one formula.', 'Verify the newly created mode is saved and available for use.']

formalized_text: Within a custom calculation mode's interface, the output fields shall be automatically recalculated and updated whenever an input field loses focus (onBlur event). Alternatively, the UI may provide a dedicated 'Calculate' button to trigger the recalculation.
original_text: As the user enters valid numerical values into the input fields, the output fields shall be calculated and updated when an input field loses focus (onBlur event) or when a dedicated 'Calculate' button is pressed.
validation_criteria: ['Open a created custom mode.', 'Enter valid values into all required input fields.', 'Tab out of the last edited input field and verify the output fields update with the correct calculated values.', "If a 'Calculate' button exists, change an input value, click the button, and verify the output fields update."]

formalized_text: The system must provide functionality for exporting and importing custom modes. The Custom Mode Management screen shall feature an 'Export' option for each mode, which generates a downloadable JSON file. A corresponding 'Import' function shall allow users to upload a valid mode definition JSON file to add it to their collection.
original_text: The Custom Mode Management screen shall provide an "Export" option for each mode... The application shall provide an "Import" function that allows a user to upload a valid mode definition JSON file.
validation_criteria: ['From the management screen, export a custom mode and verify a JSON file is downloaded.', 'Delete the exported mode from the UI.', 'Use the import function to upload the previously downloaded JSON file.', 'Verify the mode is successfully restored and available for use.']

formalized_text: User authentication and identity management shall be handled by AWS Cognito. The application will integrate with Cognito for all user registration, login, and session management functionalities.
original_text: The system shall use AWS Cognito as the external Identity Provider (IdP) for user authentication to ensure tight integration with the AWS ecosystem.
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the user registration and login flows redirect to or interact with AWS Cognito endpoints.', 'Confirm that successful login results in the application receiving a JWT issued by Cognito.', "Verify that user pools and identity pools are configured in the project's AWS Cognito service."]

formalized_text: The system must ensure that all user-specific data, including calculation history, variables, and custom modes, is securely fetched from the backend upon successful authentication and that any subsequent modifications are persisted back to the server.
original_text: Upon successful login, the user's calculation history, defined variables, and created custom modes shall be loaded from the backend. Any changes to user data (new calculations, variables, modes) shall be saved to the backend.
constraints: ["User data must be securely associated with the logged-in user and not be accessible by any other user."]
validation_criteria: ['Log in as a user with pre-existing data. Verify their history, variables, and custom modes are displayed.', 'Create a new variable. Refresh the page and verify the new variable is still present.', 'Log out and log back in. Verify the new variable is still present.']

formalized_text: The application must provide a user-initiated account deletion feature. The process must include a final, explicit confirmation step (e.g., requiring the user to type their username) to prevent accidental deletion. Successful confirmation shall trigger the permanent and irreversible removal of the user's record and all associated data from the database.
original_text: The system shall provide a mechanism for users to initiate account deletion. This action shall require the user to pass a final, non-recoverable confirmation step in the UI (e.g., typing their username). Upon confirmation, this will trigger a process to permanently remove all associated user data...
validation_criteria: ['As a test user, navigate to the account deletion interface.', 'Initiate the deletion and verify a confirmation prompt appears.', 'Complete the confirmation step (e.g., type username) and confirm.', 'Verify the user is logged out and can no longer log in with their old credentials.', "Verify in the backend database that the user's record and all their associated data (modes, history, variables) have been deleted."]

formalized_text: In the Ohm's Law & Power mode, the UI shall contain four input fields (Voltage, Current, Resistance, Power). When a user provides valid numerical input in any two of these fields, the system must immediately calculate and populate the remaining two fields based on the formulas V=IR and P=VI.
original_text: When the user enters valid numerical data into any two of the Ohm's Law fields, the other two fields shall be automatically calculated and populated in real-time.
validation_criteria: ['Enter V=12 and R=100. Verify I is calculated as 0.12 and P is calculated as 1.44.', 'Enter I=2 and P=50. Verify V is calculated as 25 and R is calculated as 12.5.', 'Clear all fields. Enter R=1k and P=1. Verify V is calculated as ~31.62 and I is calculated as ~0.03162.']

formalized_text: The 555 Timer Astable mode calculator must accept three inputs: the target Frequency, the target Duty Cycle, and the value of one known component (either resistor RA, resistor RB, or capacitor C). Based on these inputs, the system shall calculate and display the required values for the other two unknown components.
original_text: For 555 Timer Astable Mode, the UI shall require three inputs: desired Frequency, desired Duty Cycle, and the value of ONE known component (RA, RB, or C). The system shall calculate and display the values for the remaining two components.
assumptions: ['The standard formulas for 555 astable operation will be used.']
constraints: ["The system must validate that the desired duty cycle is greater than 50% and less than 100%."]
validation_criteria: ['Enter F=1kHz, Duty Cycle=75%, and C=10nF. Verify the system calculates correct values for RA and RB.', 'Enter F=100Hz, Duty Cycle=60%, and RA=10kΩ. Verify the system calculates correct values for RB and C.']

formalized_text: The application's user interface must be developed to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 at the Level AA conformance level. This includes, but is not limited to, ensuring sufficient color contrast ratios, making all interactive elements fully operable via keyboard, and providing proper semantic HTML for screen reader compatibility.
original_text: The UI shall adhere to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA standards, including proper color contrast, full keyboard navigability, and screen reader support.
validation_criteria: ['Run an automated accessibility audit (e.g., Axe, Lighthouse) and verify it reports no critical WCAG 2.1 AA violations.', 'Verify that all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, links) can be reached and activated using only the Tab and Enter/Space keys.', 'Verify that form inputs have associated labels and that images have appropriate alt text.', 'Verify that color combinations used for text and backgrounds meet the minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 (or 3:1 for large text).']

formalized_text: The frontend application architecture must be designed for internationalization (i18n). All user-facing text strings must be externalized from the code into resource files (e.g., JSON or JS modules) to allow for future translation into other languages without code changes.
original_text: The application's frontend architecture shall be designed to support internationalization (i18n), with all user-facing strings externalized into resource files.
constraints: ["The initial v1.0 launch only requires an English language implementation, but the framework must be in place."]
validation_criteria: ['Perform a code review of the frontend codebase to confirm that UI text (e.g., button labels, titles, messages) is not hardcoded in components.', "Verify the existence of resource files (e.g., `en.json`) that contain the application's strings.", 'Verify that a library or framework for i18n (e.g., `react-i18next`) is implemented to load and display strings from the resource files.']

formalized_text: All communication between the client application and the backend services shall be conducted exclusively via a RESTful API using the HTTPS protocol. The data interchange format for all API requests and responses must be JSON.
original_text: The client application shall communicate with the backend exclusively through a RESTful API. The API protocol shall be REST over HTTPS. The API data format shall be JSON.
validation_criteria: ['Monitor network traffic from the client and verify all calls to the backend are HTTP requests to REST API endpoints.', 'Verify all API requests are sent over HTTPS, not HTTP.', 'Inspect the `Content-Type` header of API requests and responses to confirm it is `application/json`.']

formalized_text: The backend RESTful API must be documented using the OpenAPI 3.0 specification. This specification file shall be automatically generated from the NestJS source code annotations and made available through a dedicated, publicly accessible API endpoint (e.g., `/api-docs`).
original_text: The API shall be documented using the OpenAPI 3.0 specification. The specification file shall be automatically generated from the backend source code and be accessible via a dedicated endpoint.
validation_criteria: ['Access the API documentation endpoint and verify that it serves a valid OpenAPI 3.0 specification document.', 'Add a new endpoint to the backend code, and verify that the documentation is automatically updated upon redeployment.', 'Verify the documentation accurately reflects the request/response models and available operations.']

formalized_text: The main application user interface must include a persistent icon, located in a consistent global area such as the main navigation bar, that serves as the single entry point for launching the in-app help system.
original_text: A persistent icon in the main navigation bar shall serve as the entry point to the in-app help system defined in REQ-FRC-001.
validation_criteria: ['Verify that a help icon (e.g., a question mark) is visible on all main views of the application.', 'Verify that clicking this icon successfully opens the help system.']

formalized_text: The client application's authentication process with AWS Cognito must be implemented using the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow with the Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) extension for enhanced security.
original_text: The application shall integrate with AWS Cognito for user authentication using the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow with Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE).
constraints: ["This flow is mandatory for public clients like SPAs."]
validation_criteria: ['Monitor the network requests during the login flow.', 'Verify the flow initiates with a request to the Cognito `/oauth2/authorize` endpoint that includes `response_type=code`, a `code_challenge`, and `code_challenge_method=S256`.', 'Verify that after successful authentication, the client exchanges the received authorization code for tokens by calling the `/oauth2/token` endpoint with a `code_verifier`.']

formalized_text: Access to all protected backend API endpoints must be controlled by requiring a valid JSON Web Token (JWT) in the `Authorization` header of the HTTP request, using the 'Bearer' scheme. The JWT must be one that was issued by AWS Cognito.
original_text: All authenticated API endpoints shall require a JWT Bearer token in the `Authorization` header, issued by the IdP.
validation_criteria: ['Attempt to call a protected API endpoint without an `Authorization` header and verify a 401 Unauthorized response is received.', 'Attempt to call a protected API endpoint with an invalid or expired token and verify a 401 Unauthorized response is received.', 'Call a protected API endpoint with a valid JWT from Cognito and verify a 2xx success response is received.']

formalized_text: The web application must be optimized for performance such that the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) metric is under 2.5 seconds when tested on a simulated standard 4G mobile network connection.
original_text: The application's initial load time, measured by Largest Contentful Paint (LCP), shall be under 2.5 seconds on a standard 4G mobile connection.
validation_criteria: ["Using a performance analysis tool like Google Lighthouse or WebPageTest, measure the LCP of the application's initial load.", "The test must be configured to simulate a 'Fast 3G' or '4G' mobile network profile.", 'Verify that the reported LCP value is less than 2.5 seconds.']

formalized_text: Under normal load conditions, 95% of all API requests for data retrieval (HTTP GET requests) must be processed by the backend and return a response in under 200 milliseconds, as measured from the time the request is received by the API Gateway to the time the response is sent.
original_text: All API calls for data retrieval shall have a 95th percentile (P95) response time of less than 200ms.
assumptions: ["'Normal load conditions' will be defined and simulated in a load testing plan."]
validation_criteria: ["Conduct a load test on the production environment's API.", 'Monitor the P95 latency for all GET endpoints over the duration of the test.', 'Verify that the P95 latency remains below the 200ms threshold.']

formalized_text: The end-to-end processing time for executing a user-defined custom formula, measured from the API request to the formula execution service until the response is returned, must be less than 500 milliseconds at the 95th percentile (P95).
original_text: The execution of a user-defined custom formula via the backend service shall have a P95 response time of less than 500ms.
assumptions: ['The complexity of user formulas is expected to be within reasonable bounds for typical calculations.']
validation_criteria: ['Conduct a load test specifically targeting the custom formula execution endpoint.', 'Monitor the P95 latency for this endpoint.', 'Verify the P95 latency remains below the 500ms threshold.']

formalized_text: The production PostgreSQL database (Amazon RDS) must be configured with automated daily snapshots. These snapshots must be retained for a period of 14 days. Additionally, the Point-In-Time Recovery (PITR) feature must be enabled, allowing for database restoration to any specific second within the backup retention period.
original_text: The primary database shall be configured for automated daily snapshots with a 14-day retention period. Point-in-time recovery shall be enabled for the database, allowing restoration to any second within the backup retention window.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the AWS RDS instance configuration for the production database.', "Verify that 'Automated backups' is enabled.", "Verify that the 'Backup retention period' is set to 14 days.", "Verify that Point-In-Time Recovery is enabled by checking the 'Latest restorable time'."]

formalized_text: The system must be designed and operated to meet a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 15 minutes, meaning no more than 15 minutes of data can be lost in a disaster. The system must also meet a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours, meaning the service must be fully restored within 4 hours of a declared disaster.
original_text: The system shall adhere to a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 15 minutes... The system shall adhere to a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours...
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the database configuration (e.g., PITR) supports the 15-minute RPO.', 'Verify that the disaster recovery plan, including infrastructure-as-code scripts and documented procedures, can realistically achieve service restoration within the 4-hour RTO.', 'Conduct a disaster recovery drill to validate the RTO.']

formalized_text: To ensure high availability, all backend services (e.g., ECS tasks) and the primary database (e.g., RDS Multi-AZ deployment) must be deployed in a configuration that spans at least two different AWS Availability Zones within a single region.
original_text: All backend services and the database shall be deployed across a minimum of two AWS Availability Zones (AZs) to ensure high availability.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the ECS service configuration and verify its subnets span at least two AZs.', "Inspect the RDS instance configuration and verify that 'Multi-AZ deployment' is enabled.", 'Simulate an AZ failure in a test environment and verify that the service remains operational.']

formalized_text: All data stored at rest within the production PostgreSQL database must be encrypted. This shall be achieved by enabling the native encryption feature of Amazon RDS, configured to use a key managed by the AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
original_text: All user data stored in the PostgreSQL database shall be encrypted at rest using AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the configuration of the production Amazon RDS instance.', "Verify that the 'Encryption' setting is enabled.", 'Verify that the encryption key specified is a KMS key.']

formalized_text: The CI/CD pipeline must integrate automated security scanning at multiple stages. This must include: 1) Static Application Security Testing (SAST) to analyze source code for vulnerabilities. 2) Software Composition Analysis (SCA) to identify known vulnerabilities in third-party dependencies. 3) Container vulnerability scanning to check the built Docker images for OS and package vulnerabilities.
original_text: The CI/CD pipeline shall include automated security scanning: Static Application Security Testing (SAST), Software Composition Analysis (SCA), and container vulnerability scanning.
constraints: ["A build that fails a security scan with critical vulnerabilities must be blocked from deploying."]
validation_criteria: ['Review the CI/CD pipeline configuration (e.g., GitHub Actions workflow file).', 'Verify the presence of a SAST scanning step (e.g., CodeQL, Snyk Code).', 'Verify the presence of an SCA scanning step (e.g., `npm audit`, Snyk Open Source).', 'Verify the presence of a container scanning step (e.g., Trivy, Amazon ECR Scan).']

formalized_text: The web server or CDN serving the application must be configured to send appropriate HTTP security headers in its responses. This must include a restrictive Content Security Policy (CSP), HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) to enforce HTTPS, and X-Frame-Options to prevent clickjacking.
original_text: The web application shall implement security headers, including Content Security Policy (CSP), HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), and X-Frame-Options, to mitigate common web vulnerabilities.
validation_criteria: ["Using browser developer tools or an online scanner, inspect the HTTP response headers for the application's main page.", 'Verify the presence of a `Content-Security-Policy` header with a reasonably strict policy.', 'Verify the presence of a `Strict-Transport-Security` header.', 'Verify the presence of an `X-Frame-Options` header (e.g., with value `DENY` or `SAMEORIGIN`).']

formalized_text: The backend services must be designed, deployed, and maintained to achieve a service level availability of 99.9% or higher, calculated monthly. This calculation excludes scheduled maintenance windows.
original_text: The backend services shall have a target uptime of 99.9%, excluding planned maintenance.
assumptions: ['Planned maintenance will be communicated to users in advance.']
validation_criteria: ['Monitor the availability of the primary API endpoint using an external monitoring service.', 'Review the monthly uptime reports from the monitoring service.', 'Verify that the calculated uptime meets or exceeds 99.9%.']

formalized_text: All cloud infrastructure resources required by the application (e.g., ECS services, Lambda functions, RDS databases, API Gateways) shall be defined, provisioned, and managed using Terraform infrastructure as code (IaC).
original_text: The entire cloud infrastructure shall be defined as code using Terraform.
constraints: ["Manual changes to the production infrastructure via the AWS console are forbidden, except in emergency break-glass scenarios."]
validation_criteria: ['Verify the existence of a Terraform project within the source control repository.', 'Review the Terraform configuration files (`.tf`) to confirm that they define all major infrastructure components.', 'Verify that changes to infrastructure are applied via `terraform apply` commands, ideally within the CI/CD pipeline.']

formalized_text: The backend service codebase must have a comprehensive suite of unit tests. The test suite must achieve and maintain a minimum of 85% code coverage for all modules containing business logic (e.g., services, controllers).
original_text: The backend codebase shall maintain a minimum of 85% unit test coverage for all business logic.
assumptions: ['Coverage will be measured against application code, excluding boilerplate and third-party modules.']
validation_criteria: ["Integrate a code coverage tool (e.g., Jest's built-in coverage) into the CI pipeline.", 'Configure the CI pipeline to fail the build if the measured code coverage for business logic falls below 85%.', 'Review the generated coverage reports to ensure key logic paths are being tested.']

formalized_text: The system's backend shall be designed using a hybrid architecture that combines containerized microservices (on AWS ECS) for persistent, stateful operations and serverless functions (on AWS Lambda) for event-driven, ephemeral tasks like formula execution.
original_text: The system shall employ a Serverless Microservices Hybrid architecture.
validation_criteria: ['Review the system architecture diagram and verify it depicts both ECS and Lambda components.', 'Verify that core services like user and data management are deployed as ECS services.', 'Verify that the secure formula execution is deployed as an AWS Lambda function.']

formalized_text: The system architecture shall consist of five primary components: 1) A React-based SPA client. 2) An Amazon API Gateway to manage and route API requests. 3) A core 'User & Data Service' running as a container on AWS ECS. 4) A 'Formula Execution Service' running as a secure AWS Lambda function. 5) An Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL managed database.
original_text: The system shall include a React-based Single Page Application (SPA) client, an API Gateway, a containerized User & Data Service on AWS ECS, a secure AWS Lambda for the Formula Execution Service, and a managed PostgreSQL instance (Amazon RDS).
validation_criteria: ['Verify each of the five specified components exists in the deployed infrastructure.', 'Verify the API Gateway is configured to route traffic to the ECS service and the Lambda function.', 'Verify the ECS service and Lambda function connect to the RDS instance.']

formalized_text: The frontend application shall be built using a specific technology stack: React 18+, TypeScript, Vite (build tool), Redux Toolkit (state management), Material-UI (component library), and Styled-components (styling). The testing stack shall consist of Jest and React Testing Library for unit/component tests, and Cypress for end-to-end tests.
original_text: The frontend framework shall be React 18+ with TypeScript, using Vite as the build tool, Redux Toolkit for state management, Material-UI for the component library, and Styled-components for styling. Testing shall be performed with Jest, React Testing Library for unit/component tests, and Cypress for end-to-end tests.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the frontend `package.json` file and verify the presence and correct versions of all specified libraries.', 'Review the source code to confirm the usage patterns of Redux Toolkit, Material-UI, and Styled-components.', 'Verify the existence of test files written using Jest/RTL syntax and Cypress syntax.']

formalized_text: The backend services shall be built using the Node.js LTS runtime and the NestJS framework. The testing stack shall consist of Jest for unit tests and Supertest for API integration tests. All application logging must be implemented using the Pino library to produce structured JSON logs.
original_text: The backend language and framework shall be Node.js (LTS) with NestJS, exposing a RESTful API. Testing shall be performed with Jest for unit tests and Supertest for API integration tests. Logging shall be implemented using Pino for structured, high-performance JSON logging.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the backend `package.json` file and verify the presence of NestJS, Jest, Supertest, and Pino.', 'Review the source code to confirm the use of NestJS decorators and modules.', 'Review the logging implementation to ensure Pino is used for structured logging.', 'Verify the existence of both Jest unit tests and Supertest integration tests.']

formalized_text: The project's technology and infrastructure stack shall consist of: AWS (cloud provider), Docker (containerization), AWS ECS with Fargate (container orchestration), GitHub Actions (CI/CD), Terraform (IaC), and AWS Secrets Manager (secret management).
original_text: The infrastructure shall use AWS, Docker, AWS ECS with Fargate, GitHub Actions for CI/CD, Terraform for IaC, and AWS Secrets Manager for secret management.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the production environment is running on AWS.', 'Verify backend services are defined in `Dockerfile`s and run as Fargate tasks on ECS.', 'Verify the CI/CD process is defined in a GitHub Actions workflow file.', 'Verify infrastructure is defined in Terraform files.', 'Verify that sensitive credentials are not in source code and are retrieved from AWS Secrets Manager.']

formalized_text: The database schema shall include a `users` table with the following columns: `id` (primary key), `auth_provider_id` (string, to link to Cognito user), `email` (string, unique), `created_at` (timestamp), and `updated_at` (timestamp).
original_text: The system shall have a `users` entity with fields: `id`, `auth_provider_id`, `email`, `created_at`, `updated_at`.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the database migration script or schema definition for the `users` table.', 'Verify that all specified columns exist with the appropriate data types.']

formalized_text: The database schema shall include a `custom_modes` table with the following columns: `id` (primary key), `user_id` (foreign key to `users.id`), `name` (string), `description` (text), `definition` (JSONB), `created_at` (timestamp), and `updated_at` (timestamp).
original_text: The system shall have a `custom_modes` entity with fields: `id`, `user_id`, `name`, `description`, `definition` (JSONB), `created_at`, `updated_at`.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the database migration script or schema definition for the `custom_modes` table.', 'Verify that all specified columns exist with the appropriate data types, including the use of JSONB for the `definition` column.', 'Verify the foreign key relationship to the `users` table is defined.']

formalized_text: The database schema shall include a `user_variables` table with the following columns: `id` (primary key), `user_id` (foreign key to `users.id`), `name` (string), `value` (string or numeric), `created_at` (timestamp), and `updated_at` (timestamp). A unique constraint must be enforced on the combination of `user_id` and `name`.
original_text: The system shall have a `user_variables` entity with fields: `id`, `user_id`, `name`, `value`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, and a unique constraint on (`user_id`, `name`).
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the database migration script for the `user_variables` table.', 'Verify all specified columns and the foreign key exist.', 'Verify the unique constraint on (`user_id`, `name`) is defined.', 'Attempt to insert two variables with the same name for the same user and verify the database rejects the second insert.']

formalized_text: The account deletion process must ensure that when a user is deleted, all associated records in the `custom_modes`, `user_variables`, and `calculation_history` tables linked to that user's ID are also permanently deleted from the database.
original_text: Upon confirmed user account deletion, all records associated with the `user_id` in `custom_modes`, `user_variables`, and `calculation_history` tables shall be permanently deleted.
constraints: ["Data deletion must be permanent and non-recoverable."]
validation_criteria: ['Create a test user and add data to their history, variables, and custom modes.', 'Execute the account deletion process for the test user.', "Query the database and verify that no records associated with the deleted user's ID remain in any of the specified tables."]

formalized_text: All database schema changes must be managed through versioned migration scripts using the migration tool provided by TypeORM. These migration scripts must be committed to the source control repository and executed automatically by the CI/CD pipeline before the new application version is deployed.
original_text: The system shall use the migration tool integrated with TypeORM to manage all schema changes. All schema modifications must be written as versioned migration scripts, stored in source control, and executed automatically as part of the CI/CD deployment process.
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the backend project contains a directory for TypeORM migration scripts.', 'Verify that schema changes are captured in new, versioned migration files, not by altering existing ones.', 'Review the CI/CD pipeline configuration to confirm there is a step that runs database migrations before the application deployment step.']

formalized_text: A continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline shall be implemented using GitHub Actions. The pipeline must be automatically triggered upon a `git push` event to any branch in the repository.
original_text: The system shall implement a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions, triggered on push to any branch.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the existence of a `.github/workflows` directory in the source code repository containing workflow definition files.', 'Push a change to a feature branch and verify that a new workflow run is automatically initiated in the GitHub Actions tab.']

formalized_text: The GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline must be structured with the following distinct stages, executed in a logical order: 1) Lint & Test, 2) Security Scan, 3) Build (application and docs), 4) API Spec Generation, 5) Push container image to Amazon ECR, 6) Database Migration, 7) Deploy infrastructure changes via Terraform.
original_text: The pipeline shall include stages for Lint & Test, Security Scan, Build, API Spec Generation, Push to Amazon ECR, Database Migration, and Deploy via Terraform.
validation_criteria: ['Review the main deployment workflow file in GitHub Actions.', 'Verify that jobs or steps corresponding to each of the seven specified stages are present.', 'Confirm that the Database Migration stage runs before the Deploy stage.']

formalized_text: The Terraform configuration shall utilize workspaces to manage the infrastructure for different environments. Separate workspaces named `dev`, `staging`, and `prod` must be used to maintain isolated state files and configurations for each environment.
original_text: The system shall use Terraform workspaces to maintain separate, isolated state for `dev`, `staging`, and `prod` environments.
validation_criteria: ['Verify that the CI/CD deployment scripts for each environment include a command to select the appropriate Terraform workspace (e.g., `terraform workspace select prod`).', 'Inspect the Terraform state backend (e.g., an S3 bucket) and verify that separate state files exist for each environment.']

formalized_text: No sensitive information, such as database passwords, API keys, or private certificates, shall be stored in the source code repository. All such secrets must be stored securely in AWS Secrets Manager and retrieved by the application services at runtime.
original_text: All sensitive data shall be stored in AWS Secrets Manager and retrieved by the application at runtime, not hardcoded in the repository.
validation_criteria: ['Perform a scan of the source code repository for hardcoded secrets and verify none are found.', "Verify that the application's IAM role has permissions to read secrets from AWS Secrets Manager.", "Review the application's startup code to confirm it fetches configuration secrets from AWS Secrets Manager."]

formalized_text: The system must adhere to a strict, structured logging standard for all services. Every log entry must be a JSON object containing at least: a timestamp, log level, service name, a unique Correlation ID, and a message. The Correlation ID shall be generated by the API Gateway for each incoming request and propagated via HTTP headers to all downstream services, which must include it in their logs.
original_text: A formal logging standard shall be enforced. Every log entry must include a timestamp, log level, service name, a unique Correlation ID, and a detailed message. The Correlation ID must be generated at the API Gateway for each request and propagated to all downstream services...
validation_criteria: ['Make an API request and inspect the logs in CloudWatch.', 'Verify that all log entries related to that request are in JSON format and contain the required fields.', 'Verify that all log entries for that single request share the same Correlation ID.', 'Verify the Correlation ID was present in the HTTP headers between services.']

formalized_text: A set of critical monitoring alarms shall be configured in Amazon CloudWatch. These alarms must automatically trigger notifications (e.g., via SNS to email or a chat application) to the development team when predefined thresholds for errors, latency, or resource utilization are breached.
original_text: CloudWatch Alarms shall be configured to automatically notify the development team for critical events.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the existence of a CloudWatch alarm for API Gateway 5xx errors (>1% over 5 min).', 'Verify the existence of a CloudWatch alarm for P99 API latency (>1 sec).', 'Verify the existence of CloudWatch alarms for ECS service CPU/Memory utilization (>80%).', 'Verify the existence of CloudWatch alarms for Lambda function errors and timeouts.']

formalized_text: The backend API shall be the authoritative enforcer of all business rules and data validation logic. It must independently validate all incoming data to ensure integrity, without trusting client-side validation.
original_text: All business rules specified in this section must be enforced within the backend API to ensure data integrity, regardless of the client-side implementation.
validation_criteria: ["Using an API client (e.g., Postman), send a request that violates a business rule (e.g., a negative resistance for Ohm's Law).", 'Verify that the API rejects the request with an appropriate 4xx status code and a descriptive error message.', 'Repeat this test for all key business rules defined in REQ-BIZ-001.']

formalized_text: The backend validation for the 555 Timer Astable mode calculation must enforce that the input value for 'Duty Cycle' is a number strictly greater than 50 and strictly less than 100 (representing percentage).
original_text: The system shall enforce that the requested duty cycle in the 555 Timer Astable mode is greater than 50% and less than 100%.
validation_criteria: ['Attempt a 555 Astable calculation via the API with a duty cycle of 49%. Verify the request is rejected.', 'Attempt a 555 Astable calculation via the API with a duty cycle of 100%. Verify the request is rejected.', 'Attempt a 555 Astable calculation via the API with a duty cycle of 50.1%. Verify the request is accepted.']

formalized_text: The AWS Cognito User Pool for this application must be configured with a password policy that requires passwords to have a minimum length of 12 characters and contain at least one of each of the following: an uppercase letter, a lowercase letter, a number, and a special character.
original_text: The AWS Cognito Identity Provider (IdP) shall be configured to enforce that user passwords have a minimum length of 12 characters and include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.
validation_criteria: ['Inspect the password policy settings within the AWS Cognito User Pool configuration.', 'Verify the minimum length is set to 12.', 'Verify that the requirements for uppercase, lowercase, number, and special character are all enabled.', 'During user registration, attempt to create a password that violates this policy and verify Cognito rejects it.']

formalized_text: For all application updates following the initial launch, a Blue/Green deployment strategy must be used. This involves deploying the new version ('Green') alongside the existing version ('Blue'), allowing for testing before redirecting live traffic, which minimizes downtime and enables near-instantaneous rollback by redirecting traffic back to 'Blue'.
original_text: All subsequent updates and feature releases shall use a "Blue/Green" deployment strategy to minimize downtime and provide an immediate rollback capability.
validation_criteria: ['Verify the CI/CD pipeline and infrastructure (e.g., using weighted routing in Route 53 or ECS deployment controllers) support a Blue/Green deployment pattern.', 'Perform a test deployment and verify that the new version is deployed without affecting the live version until traffic is explicitly switched.', 'Perform a rollback test by switching traffic back to the previous version.']

formalized_text: For new users logging in for the first time, the system shall display a one-time, dismissible guided tour. This tour must highlight key UI elements, including the main calculator display, the control for switching between modes, and the icon for accessing the help system.
original_text: The system shall implement a one-time, dismissible guided tour for first-time users, highlighting the main UI components, mode switching, and the location of the help system.
validation_criteria: ['Register a new user account and log in for the first time. Verify the guided tour starts automatically.', 'Complete the tour and verify it highlights the correct UI elements.', 'Dismiss the tour. Log out and log back in. Verify the tour does not appear again.']

formalized_text: The system's design, data handling procedures, and user-facing features must comply with the requirements of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). This includes providing mechanisms for user data access and deletion, and obtaining user consent where required.
original_text: The system shall be compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA).
assumptions: ['Legal counsel will provide the specific text for policies and consent forms.']
validation_criteria: ['Verify a mechanism exists for users to request access to their personal data.', "Verify the account deletion feature (REQ-1-031) fulfills the 'right to be forgotten'.", 'Verify that user consent is obtained for the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy during registration.']

formalized_text: The user registration form must include a mandatory checkbox or similar control requiring users to explicitly acknowledge and accept the application's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy before their account can be created.
original_text: Users shall be required to explicitly accept the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy during the account registration process.
validation_criteria: ['Navigate to the registration page and verify the presence of a checkbox for accepting the ToS and Privacy Policy.', 'Verify that links to the full text of both documents are provided.', 'Attempt to submit the registration form without checking the box and verify that registration fails with an appropriate error message.']
